title: Champ Select Freeze
body:
Every 15-20 games, while I am in champ select and another player is picking, the timer will count down to 0, and freeze. I can't see their pick, or the following picks. What is worse, is that eventually it comes time for me to select my champion, and I cannot select, which ultimately results in my (unwilling) dodge.  I can still type in chat and see responses, and when I am in a premade I am assured the champ select is progressing normally. The only way I have been able to escape is to close the client.

This issue has been occurring for the past couple of months, and is becoming more and more frequent, to the point of it happening two games in a row today, causing me to dodge champ select and incur LP loss. This happens when I am playing solo as well as when in a premade, both ranked and normals. I do not believe it is a problem with my ISP, because it has occurred while in a premade with my roommate, who had no such issues. There is no other connection issue that I can detect - voice chat works normally, internet browsers function normally, in-lobby chat does not lag. Only the champ select process freezes.

When this only came up every once in a while it was only an annoyance, but with it more and more frequent it will have a serious impact on my ability to play ranked.

replies.body:
Hmmmm even though it doesn't happen very often, we should still take a step back and fix this up before hopping back into another matchmade game. I don't want you to end up freezing up again and getting any penalties for this.

It sounds like your client is having some hiccups every once and awhile and partially losing its connection to the game lobby you were in. When you can't select or see any champs in the lobby, it's because your network isn't able to send or receive that information to and from our servers. Run through this [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to make sure you cover all your bases, but pay special attention to how to flush your DNS.

Thanks for the timely reply. 

Went through the connection guide, flushed DNS. Is there any way to know if the issue has been resolved besides playing more games and crossing my fingers?
The best way to test it is in a custom or practice game, since you won't get any penalties for leaving or disconnecting from those game modes!
I have the same problem too, but I can't see other players responses. I can't even close the game. I have to "Ctrl+Alt+del". and then I can't open game again and I AFK
